text: Now that Mueller's report has been filed, the next questions is how much of it the public will get to see and how soon. Atty. Gen. Barr is vague about that, promising "transparency," but not specifics.
author: DavidLauter

text: Americans are pessimistic about what the U.S. will be like in 2050, with whites especially gloomy about the prospect of a non-white majority country, @pewresearch finds.
author: DavidLauter

text: Nominating Stephen Moore, if Trump really goes thru with the plan, will pose an interesting test for Senate Republicans.
author: DavidLauter

text: Are Google searches biased against conservatives? Robert Epstein has gained a measure of fame by saying they are. But as @evanhalper reports, even his detractors say Google's lack of transparency about its algorithms poses a problem.
author: DavidLauter

text: Conservatives love Robert Epstein's warnings that Google searches are biased in favor of liberals. But, as @evanhalper reports, even academics who doubt Epstein's conclusions agree that the public needs to know more about how Google's algorithms work. https://www.latimes.com/politics/la-na-pol-google-search-bias-elections-20190322-story.html …
author: DavidLauter

text: Deployments to the border and shifts of $ for border security have helped create an “unacceptable risk to Marine Corps combat readiness and solvency,” Commandant says in internal memos. A scoop by @mollymotoole
author: DavidLauter

text: Congrats to @JimPuzzanghera and to @BostonGlobe. We’re going to miss Jim, but it’s a great opportunity for one of the truly good guys.
author: DavidLauter

text: As the administration presses to isolate Huawei, some major U.S. universities have begun to cut ties with the Chinese tech giant, Don Lee reports.
author: DavidLauter

text: You know the DC media cycle has moved into overdrive when photogs stake out driveways to get pix of people arriving at their offices. As everyone waits for Mueller's report, there's a lot we already have learned, as @ChrisMegerian & @DelWilber write.
author: DavidLauter

text: We don't know what's in Mueller's final report, but we do know an awful lot about his investigation already. Let @ChrisMegerian & @DelWilber guide you thru nearly two years of findings. https://www.latimes.com/politics/la-na-pol-mueller-report-release-backstory-20190320-story.html?utm_source=dlvr.it&utm_medium=twitter …
author: DavidLauter

text: Smart look by @sarahdwire at the diverging strategies of Orange County's new, freshmen D reps. Varied ways that Ds hope to hold on to formerly R territory captured in 2018.
author: DavidLauter

text: Howard University provided a formative experience for a young @KamalaHarris. As a presidential candidate, it provides a touchstone in a campaign where some question her identity, @evanhalper writes.
author: DavidLauter

text: Only one state in the country (Oregon) still allows non-unanimous verdicts in criminal cases. The Supreme Court will decide if the Constitution forbids that, @DavidGSavage reports.
author: DavidLauter

text: "@JoeBiden is carrying a 20th century voting record into a 21st century political dogfight," writes @hookjan. The way he's out of step today says a lot about how the Dem party has changed during his career. Will that sink him now?
author: DavidLauter

text: Cynical about college admissions? Of course, and for good reason. But as @TeresaWatanabe writes, the scandal isn’t the whole story. many elite schools have made big strides in economic diversity.
author: DavidLauter

text: Beto O'Rourke has gotten non-stop attention in Iowa. But the state's voters seem less wowed than some of the media, @evanhalper reports.
author: DavidLauter

text: Two myths about politics and my review of the week, with some excellent @latimespolitics coverage.
author: DavidLauter

text: Can't emphasize this often enough. As new @pewresearch reiterates -- lots of Americans say they're "independents," but vast majority reliably lean to GOP or Dems & vote accordingly. Idea that there's a huge well of independent voters waiting for 3rd party is bunk.
author: DavidLauter

text: Good Gallup baseline on Jewish attitudes toward Democrats, Republicans & Trump. About half of American Jews ID as Ds, only one in six as Rs. By 71%-26%, Jews disapprove of Trump. Maybe Rs can capitalize on controversy over Rep. Omar but it's a steep hill.
author: DavidLauter

text: ABP: Always be projecting.
author: DavidLauter

text: O'Rourke is presumed to have appeal to younger voters. If so, he'll run head on into @BernieSanders, who leads the field among the young. Earlier this year, Bernie supporters went hard after Beto. Expect more of that.
author: DavidLauter

text: Beto O'Rourke proved he could excite a lot of Democrats. Is excitement enough to make a presidential campaign work? @evanhalper with the announcement. https://www.latimes.com/politics/la-na-pol-beto-orourke-president-election-20190314-story.html …
author: DavidLauter

text: “He has demanded ‘goddamned steam’ to power the Navy’s aircraft carriers and prefers a wall to drones” to protect the border @EliStokols on the Luddite in chief.
author: DavidLauter

text: Are you a Democrat? Looking for something to be nervous about? (Sorry, that's redundant), @Redistrict has you covered -- a true nightmare scenario for the party, brought to you by earnest efforts to reform party rules.
author: DavidLauter

text: Really hard to beat James Buchanan in the "worst president" competition -- significant culpability for the Civil War and pretty much no accomplishments to offset it.
author: DavidLauter

text: The affidavit quotes from a wiretapped conversation in which the head of the scheme discusses that very question: Giving a big donation just gets you a "second look," he said. "My families want a guarantee."
author: DavidLauter

text: Pelosi puts on the record what she's been saying privately: "I’m not for impeachment." Says to WashPost that it's "so divisive to the country ... unless there’s something so compelling and overwhelming and bipartisan, I don’t think we should go down that path..."
author: DavidLauter

text: Do rich people flee CA because of high taxes? Nope, as George Skelton writes, the data is very clear: Rich folks are moving into CA. It's lower-income folks who leave; they're priced out of the housing market.
author: DavidLauter

text: Govs, like Hickenlooper, will try to sell the ability to work across party lines, but not all voters are buying. “That working-with-Republicans stuff doesn’t work for me ...I don’t want to work with Republicans. I just want to destroy them," one Iowa Dem tells @hookjan
author: DavidLauter

text: After a winter dominated by senators, the Democratic presidential field gets an infusion of governors, shifting the debate, @hookjan reports.
author: DavidLauter

text: Not long ago, a fashionable view held that we’d be better off without a daily WH briefing. As @sbg shows, the only thing worse than having a flawed briefing is having none.
author: DavidLauter

text: Certainly more so than 93-95.
author: DavidLauter

text: If/when lawmakers seriously debate reducing mass incarceration in the U.S., one way to frame the debate: Should sentences like Manafort's become typical or remain outliers for the wealthy? My review of the week and some great @latimespolitics coverage.
author: DavidLauter

text: Smart analysis -- as usual -- from @amyewalter: The reason politics is polarized isn't primarily that political figures indulge in combative rhetoric, it's that voters on the two sides fundamentally disagree about what's important.
author: DavidLauter

text: Also, of course, increases odds of Ds getting a Senate majority.
author: DavidLauter

text: Cue the flood alerts.
author: DavidLauter
